definition: lit. to return in a swirl of dust (idiom)/fig. to regroup and come back even stronger/to make a comeback
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
to roll (up)/to sweep up/to carry on/roll
Tu (ethnic group)/surname Tu
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Eventually, TV reasserted itself into my life.
sentences.chinese: 电视后来在我的生活中卷土重来。

sentences.english: THERE was no return of the mutineers - not so much as another shot out of the woods.
sentences.chinese: 反叛者们没有卷土重来，树林中再也没听到枪声。

sentences.english: Thrawn did, though, have some sort of plan to return.
sentences.chinese: 然而，索龙确实想到过卷土重来的计划。

sentences.english: Now Pitkowsky, 46, and Trauner, 54, are back.
sentences.chinese: 如今，46岁的皮考斯基和54岁的特劳纳卷土重来。

sentences.english: That problem has brought compressed-air energy storage roaring back.
sentences.chinese: 这一问题使得‘压缩空气储能’卷土重来。

sentences.english: His hatred of Trina came back upon him like a returning surge.
sentences.chinese: 他对屈丽娜的痛恨象卷土重来的浪潮，又回复了。

sentences.english: They squat in illegal structures, which Beijing destroys as it keeps expanding.
sentences.chinese: 他们蜷缩在违章建筑里，被政府摧毁又卷土重来。

sentences.english: And the beast shall come forth surrounded by a roiling cloud of vengeance.
sentences.chinese: 野兽将靠复仇之云卷土重来。

sentences.english: Three days later, Kearns, once again driving the Galaxie, reappeared for his appointment with Neill.
sentences.chinese: 三天后，卡恩斯卷土重来，如约见到了内尔。

sentences.english: No word yet on whether horsemeat will make a comeback.
sentences.chinese: 但还不能肯定马肉是否会卷土重来。

sentences.english: Ten years ago, when dinosaurs began to make their greatest comeback in 100,000 years, everyone wondered what the appeal was for kids.
sentences.chinese: 十年以前，恐龙开始以十万年来未有的声势卷土重来。

sentences.english: Capri pants are making a comeback and can also be found here.
sentences.chinese: 卡普里裤正在卷土重来，也可以在这里找到。

sentences.english: Turtlenecks are having a sudden revival in 2015.
Today, natural Vanilla is making a comeback due to high demand from perfume industry.
sentences.chinese: 今天，天然香草正卷土重来，由于从香水业的高要求。

sentences.english: Then, last weekend, they regrouped under a new name.
sentences.chinese: 上个周末，他们更换了名字，卷土重来。

sentences.english: After my leg heals, it will be nice to be back in the saddle again.
sentences.chinese: 我得腿伤好了以后就要卷土重来。

definition: lit. to reorganize flags and drums (idiom); to regroup after a setback/to prepare for new initiatives/to attempt a comeback
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
(do sth) on a large scale
to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
to recover lost territory
to revitalize/to restore (prestige, prosperity etc)/revival/recovery
to counterattack/a counteroffensive
to return
lit. ashes burn once more (idiom); fig. sb lost returns to have influence/sth malevolent returns to haunt one
(of a person) to return to the fray after a period of inactivity/to jump back into the thick of things/(of sth that was once popular) to be resurrected/to make a comeback
to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
to reappear
to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
to return to
